Mikhail Gorbachev is in New York on a visit intended to showcase a more benign Soviet foreign policy and set an agenda for dealings with the Bush administration. Page A1

The Gorbachevs swept to Manhattan waving from their Zil limousine, which probably missed the Gorbachev look-alike at Trump Tower. The city that never sleeps but is always ready to yawn was excited, in a sort of blase way. A1

Three people were killed in Baku, the Azerbaijani capital, and 44 were wounded in rioting that followed the forcible early-morning disperal of a rally on a central square, the military commander of the city said. A3

Mikhail Gorbachev's U.N. address today shows the change in Moscow's view of the United Nations: a major player in world affairs rather than a platform to attack the West and court the third world. A18

Yasir Arafat met five U.S. Jews in Sweden to discuss the prospects for peace in the Middle East. Mr. Arafat used the day's symbolism to portray himself as a moderate Middle East peace broker. A6 Labor will reconsider a coalition with the Likud party when it holds a Central Committee vote. Shimon Peres called for the vote to reopen negotiations one day after saying such talks were unworkable. A6

William Webster will be C.I.A. chief in the next administration, the President-elect said, naming choices for Commerce Secretary, representative to the United Nations and U.S. Special Trade Representative. A1

A top lawmaker said a tax increase is undoubtedly needed to reduce the budget deficit. Dan Rostenkowski, who heads the House tax-writing committee, said his first choice was to increase the tax on gasoline. A1

Attorneys prosecuting Oliver North pared back their case against him, saying they no longer contend that he used the profits from U.S. arms sales for any illegal purpose except covert war in Central America. A1

The Justice Department told doctors that they are under surveillance for evidence of price fixing and other violations of the antitrust laws. Grand jury investigations are under way in three cities. A1
The shuttle Atlantis landed safely at Edwards Air Force Base in California in the afternoon, testing its newly designed brakes and nose wheel steering system. D22

Son of an old Massachusetts family, Joseph Eaton was homeless when he died outside a San Francisco restaurant. Mr. Eaton had struggled against addictions to alcohol and drugs for many years, reports said. A22
Global warming caused by pollution will make droughts much more frequent and storms much fiercer, new data presented at a conference on climate change show. A25
